tit.cmt: 「東洋自由党」は、日本語のローマ字表記＋(英語訳)の順で訳しました。

sen.j: 東洋自由党（とうようじゆうとう）は、1892年11月6日に自由党_(明治)左派の大井憲太郎が、樽井藤吉（元東洋社会党）や小久保喜七、新井章吾らとともに結成した政党。
sen.e: The Toyo Jiyuto (Oriental Liberal Party) was a political party formed by Kentaro OI, a member of the (Meiji) left wing of the Jiyuto (Liberal Party), along with Tokichi TARUI (a former member of the Toyo Shakaito [Oriental Social Party]), Kishichi KOKUBO, Shogo ARAI and other politicians on November 6, 1892.

The Toyo Jiyuto (Oriental Liberal Party) was a political party formed by Kentaro OI, a member of the (Meiji) left wing of the Jiyuto (Liberal Party), along with Tokichi TARUI (a former member of the Toyo Shakaito [Oriental Social Party]), Kishichi KOKUBO, Shogo ARAI and other politicians on November 6, 1892.

The Toyo Jiyuto (Oriental Liberal Party) was a political party formed by Kentaro OI, a member of the (Meiji) left wing of the Jiyuto (Liberal Party), along with Tokichi TARUI (a former member of the Toyo Shakaito [Oriental Social Party]), Kishichi KOKUBO, Shogo ARAI and other politicians on November 6, 1892.

sen.j: 自由党の幹部であった大井は帝国議会開設後の1891年5月、自由党内にアジア主義・急進的自由主義を掲げた東洋倶楽部という派閥を結成していたが、土佐派の星亨との政争に敗れて東洋自由党を結成した。
sen.e: In May, 1891, after the Imperial Diet was established, Oi, a former executive member of the Jiyuto, formed within the Jiyuto a faction called the Toyo Kurabu (Oriental Club), which upheld Asianism and ultraliberalism, however, after losing a political battle with Tosa School member Toru HOSHI, he formed the Toyo Jiyuto.

In May, 1891, after the Imperial Diet was established, Oi, a former executive member of the Jiyuto, formed within the Jiyuto a faction called the Toyo Kurabu (Oriental Club), which upheld Asianism and ultraliberalism, however, after losing a political battle with Tosa School member Toru HOSHI, he formed the Toyo Jiyuto.

In May, 1891, after the Imperial Diet was established, Oi, a former executive member of the Jiyuto, formed within the Jiyuto a faction called the Toyo Kurabu (Oriental Club), which upheld Asianism and ultraliberalism, however, after losing a political battle with Tosa School member Toru HOSHI, he formed the Toyo Jiyuto.

sen.j: ただし、大井自身は完全な新党ではなく、自由党の別働隊であるとする立場を表明していた。
sen.e: Still, Oi himself took a stance to regard the Toyo Jiyuto not as a completely new party but as a detached force of the Jiyuto.
However he clearly announced that he regarded the Toyo Jiyuto as a branch of the Jiyuto and that it was not a completely new party.
sen.cmt: 意味をわかりやすくするために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: However he clearly announced that he regarded the Toyo Jiyuto as a branch of the Jiyuto and that it was not a completely new party.

sen.j: なお、大井自身は第2回衆議院議員総選挙における選挙干渉の影響で落選していた（第3回衆議院議員総選挙で復帰）。
sen.e: Meanwhile, Oi lost the second general election of the members of the House of Representatives due to the Cabinet's intervention in the election (He was reelected in the third general election of the members of the House of Representatives).
sen.cmt: 「選挙干渉」は、ウェブ検索で(当時の)内閣による選挙への干渉とありましたのでthe Cabinet’s intervention in the election と英訳しました。
sen.e: Meanwhile, Oi lost the second general election of the members of the House of Representatives due to the Cabinet's intervention in the election (He was reelected in the third general election of the members of the House of Representatives).

Meanwhile, Oi lost the second general election of the members of the House of Representatives due to the Cabinet's intervention in the election (He was reelected in the third general election of the members of the House of Representatives).

sen.j: 主な対外政策としては、アジアに対してはアジア全域の革新運動の盟主に日本が立つことを主張して、欧米列強に対しては強硬な外交政策を掲げた。
sen.e: As its major foreign policies, the Toyo Jiyuto declared to Asian nations that Japan would become a leader of the reform movement throughout Asia, while it declared its hard-line foreign policy toward the allied Western powers.

As its major foreign policies, the Toyo Jiyuto declared to Asian nations that Japan would become a leader of the reform movement throughout Asia, while it declared its hard-line foreign policy toward the allied Western powers.

As its major foreign policies, the Toyo Jiyuto declared to Asian nations that Japan would become a leader of the reform movement throughout Asia, while it declared its hard-line foreign policy toward the allied Western powers.

sen.j: その一方で国内政策においては、貧民労働者の保護と立憲政治・普通選挙の実現を掲げて党内に普通選挙期成同盟会、日本労働協会、小作条例調査会を設置して、機関誌「新東洋」を刊行した。
sen.e: Meanwhile, as its domestic policies, the party set up in it the Association for Promoting Universal Suffrage, the Japan Labor Association and the Research Council on Tenant Farming Ordinance, with a goal of protecting poor laborers and realizing constitutional government and universal suffrage, and it also published the party newspaper "New Orient."
sen.cmt: 普通選挙期成同盟会、日本労働協会、小作条例調査会はそれぞれ「定訳不明」ですが、とりあえずthe Association for Promoting Universal Suffrage, the Japan Labor Association and the Research Council on Tenant Farming Ordinanceと表現しました。
sen.e: For it's domestic policies, the party set up an Association for Promoting Universal Suffrage, the Japan Labor Association and the Research Council on Tenant Farming Ordinance, with the goal of protecting poor laborers and realizing constitutional government and universal suffrage, and also published the party newspaper titled, "New Orient."
sen.cmt: 意味をわかりやすくするために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: For it's domestic policies, the party set up an Association for Promoting Universal Suffrage, the Japan Labor Association and the Research Council on Tenant Farming Ordinance, with the goal of protecting poor laborers and realizing constitutional government and universal suffrage, and also published the party newspaper titled, "New Orient."

sen.j: だが、条約改正の本格化とともに漸進的改正論を唱える自由党との距離を置いて、対外硬派の立場から国民協会_(日本)や新興の大日本協会との関係を強める。
sen.e: With the treaty revision under way in earnest, however, the party distanced itself from the Liberal Party, which advocated the idea of gradual treaty revision, and because of its hard-line stance toward foreign nations, it strengthened the ties with the Kokumin Kyokai (National Association [Japan]) and burgeoning Dai Nihon Kyokai (Society for Greater Japan).

With the treaty revision under way in earnest, however, the party distanced itself from the Liberal Party, which advocated the idea of gradual treaty revision, and because of its hard-line stance toward foreign nations, it strengthened the ties with the Kokumin Kyokai (National Association [Japan]) and burgeoning Dai Nihon Kyokai (Society for Greater Japan).

With the treaty revision under way in earnest, however, the party distanced itself from the Liberal Party, which advocated the idea of gradual treaty revision, and because of its hard-line stance toward foreign nations, it strengthened the ties with the Kokumin Kyokai (National Association [Japan]) and burgeoning Dai Nihon Kyokai (Society for Greater Japan).

sen.j: 1893年12月、東洋自由党は解党して大日本協会に合流した。
sen.e: In December, 1893, the Toyo Jiyuto dissolved and its members joined the Dai Nihon Kyokai.
In December, 1893, the Toyo Jiyuto was dissolved and its members joined the Dai Nihon Kyokai.
sen.cmt: 意味をわかりやすくするために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: In December, 1893, the Toyo Jiyuto was dissolved and its members joined the Dai Nihon Kyokai.

sen.j: ただし、大日本協会そのものがこの直後に解散に追い込まれており、大井は自由党に戻ることになる。
sen.e: Soon after that, however, the Dai Nihon Kyokai itself was driven to break up, and as a result, Oi returned to the Jiyuto.
sen.cmt: 「追い込まれており、大井は」の部分は「追い込まれており、その結果大井は」と解釈し….break up, and as a result, Oi….としました。
sen.e: Soon after that, however, the Dai Nihon Kyokai itself was dissolved and Oi returned to the Jiyuto.
sen.cmt: 意味をわかりやすくするために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: Soon after that, however, the Dai Nihon Kyokai itself was dissolved and Oi returned to the Jiyuto.

sen.j: また、普通選挙期成同盟会などの諸団体はその後も大井のもとで継続されていくことになる。
sen.e: And even after that, the Association for Promoting Universal Suffrage and the other organizations continued their activities under the supervision of Oi.
sen.cmt: 「大井のもとで」は、「大井の指揮・監督のもとで」と解釈しunder the supervision of Oiと訳出しました。
sen.e: The Association for Promoting Universal Suffrage and the other organizations continued on under Oi.
sen.cmt: 意味をわかりやすくするために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: The Association for Promoting Universal Suffrage and the other organizations continued on under Oi.
